title: Can new campaign help women break into the economics boys' club?
text:
A woman took a share in the Nobel prize for economics today as Esther Duflo was recognised with two colleagues for her work in addressing global poverty.

But it remains a standing rebuke to the profession that the title has only once before been bestowed on a woman in the Nobel's 50-year history, when US economist Elinor Ostrom also shared the award in 2009.

Female economists hold senior positions at bodies such as the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank, but concerns are such over the discipline's gender imbalance that the Royal Economics Society is tomorrow launching a new diversity campaign to address the lack of women taking on the subject at an early age.
